prompts.text:
# How to Use Right-Click Prompt

## Organizing Prompts
1. Click '+' next to 'My Folders' to create a new folder
2. Click '+' on any folder to add a new prompt
3. Give your prompt a title and paste your prompt text

## Using Prompts
1. Right-click anywhere in your browser or application
2. Find 'Right Click Prompt' in the context menu
3. Navigate to your folder and select your prompt
4. The prompt will be copied to your clipboard automatically
5. Paste it wherever you need (Ctrl+V or Cmd+V)

## Auto-Paste Feature
1. Enable 'Auto-Paste' toggle in this popup
2. Grant permissions when prompted
3. When you select a prompt from the right-click menu, it will try to automatically paste with formatting preserved
4. Note: Auto-paste works in most text fields and editors but may not work in all contexts

## Need More Help?
Visit our guide at: https://aiadopters.substack.com/p/right-click-prompt
prompts.title: Getting Started with RCP

prompts.text: hi
prompts.title: Test

prompts.text:
# Instructions
Replace the variables with your specific information:
{{topic}} - Subject of the blog post
{{audience}} - Target readers (e.g., tech enthusiasts, parents)
{{key_points}} - Main points to include in the introduction
{{hook}} - Attention-grabbing opener (question, statistic, etc.)

# Alternative Usage
Instead of filling in all variables, you can:
- Copy/paste a related article or website content and say "Use this as reference"
- Attach a PDF about the topic and say "Extract key points from this document"
- Simply provide the topic and say "Generate a blog introduction for {{topic}}"

# Prompt
You are a skilled content writer crafting an engaging introduction (approximately 100-150 words) 
for a blog post about {{topic}}. 

Your target audience is {{audience}}. 

Begin with a compelling hook: {{hook}}. 

Then, seamlessly incorporate the following key points: 
{{key_points}}. 

Write in a tone that is both engaging and informative, ensuring it resonates with {{audience}}. 
Aim to pique their interest and set the stage for the rest of the post.
prompts.title: Blog Post Introduction

prompts.text:
# Instructions
Replace the variables with your specific information:
{{product}} - Name of the product
{{USP}} - Unique selling proposition
{{features}} - Key features (list 3-5)
{{benefits}} - Benefits the product offers
{{audience}} - Target buyers

# Alternative Usage
Instead of filling in all variables, you can:
- Attach a product brochure or spec sheet and say "Use this to create a description"
- Paste a competitor's product description and say "Create something similar for my product"
- Simply provide the product name and say "Research and write a description for {{product}}"

# Prompt
You are an expert copywriter tasked with crafting a compelling product description 
(approximately 200-250 words) for {{product}}. 

Start by highlighting its unique selling proposition: 
{{USP}}. 

Then, detail its key features: 
{{features}}

And emphasize the benefits: 
{{benefits}}. 

Tailor your language and tone to resonate with {{audience}}, using persuasive, 
descriptive, and sensory language that appeals to their emotions and needs. 
Focus on how the product can solve their problems or enhance their lives.
prompts.title: Product Description

prompts.text:
# Instructions
Replace the variables with your specific information:
{{audience}} - Target audience (e.g., subscribers, leads)
{{action}} - Desired action (e.g., sign up, buy now)
{{benefit}} - Key benefit they'll gain
{{urgency}} - Reason to act now (e.g., limited time offer)

# Alternative Usage
Instead of filling in all variables, you can:
- Paste your landing page content and say "Create a CTA for this page"
- Simply state "Create a CTA for {{product/service}} targeting {{basic audience info}}"
- Provide examples of CTAs you like and say "Create something similar for my product"

# Prompt
You are a seasoned content creator designing a powerful call-to-action (CTA) 
for a marketing campaign targeting {{audience}}. 

Your goal is to persuade them to {{action}} by highlighting the key benefit: 
{{benefit}}. 

Incorporate a sense of urgency or exclusivity: 
{{urgency}}. 

Use a tone that is urgent, compelling, and action-oriented. 
Structure your CTA as a clear, concise command, followed by the benefit and urgency, 
e.g., "Sign up today to unlock exclusive contentâ€”offer ends soon!"
prompts.title: Call-to-Action

prompts.text:
# Instructions
Replace the variables with your specific information:
{{business_name}} - Your company name
{{product_service}} - Your product or service
{{competitor1}} - First main competitor
{{competitor2}} - Second main competitor
{{target_audience}} - Your ideal customers

# Alternative Usage
Instead of filling in all variables, you can:
- Attach competitor websites or marketing materials and say "Analyze these competitors"
- Upload industry reports and say "Extract competitor insights from this document"
- Simply state "Analyze {{competitor1}} and {{competitor2}} for my business {{business_name}}"

# Prompt
You are a strategic consultant for {{business_name}}. 

Create a comprehensive competitor analysis report for {{product_service}} examining 
{{competitor1}} and {{competitor2}}. 

Focus on their:

1. Market positioning and unique value propositions
2. Pricing strategies and product/service features
3. Marketing approach and audience engagement tactics
4. Strengths and weaknesses relative to {{business_name}}

Conclude with 3 actionable opportunities for {{business_name}} to gain competitive 
advantage with {{target_audience}}. 

Format your response with clear headings and bullet points for easy reference.
prompts.title: Competitor Analysis Report

prompts.text:
# Instructions
Replace the variables with your specific information:
{{business_name}} - Your company name
{{product_name}} - Your product or service
{{demographics}} - Target customer demographics
{{budget}} - Available marketing budget
{{timeframe}} - Implementation timeline

# Alternative Usage
Instead of filling in all variables, you can:
- Upload your business plan and say "Extract acquisition strategy from this document"
- Paste your website content and say "Develop acquisition strategies based on this"
- Simply ask "Create a customer acquisition strategy for my {{type}} business with {{budget}}"

# Prompt
You are a market researcher for {{business_name}}. 

Analyze customer acquisition strategies for {{product_name}} targeting 
{{demographics}} with a budget of {{budget}} over {{timeframe}}. 

Provide:

1. Three optimal acquisition channels with ROI estimates
2. Customized messaging approaches for each channel
3. Key performance indicators to track success
4. Potential challenges and mitigation strategies

Format your response as a strategic plan with clear sections, 
highlighting the most cost-effective approaches first. 
Include specific action items for implementation.
prompts.title: Customer Acquisition Strategy

prompts.text:
# Instructions
Replace the variables with your specific information:
{{function_name}} - Name of the function/method
{{description}} - What the code does
{{parameters}} - Inputs the function takes
{{return_value}} - What the function returns
{{example}} - Example usage code

# Alternative Usage
Instead of filling in all variables, you can:
- Paste your code directly and say "Document this function"
- Upload a code file and say "Create documentation for the main functions"
- Simply provide function signatures and say "Generate documentation for these functions"

# Prompt
You are a meticulous software engineer documenting a function for other developers. 

Write a comprehensive comment that includes:

- Function name: {{function_name}}
- Description: {{description}}
- Parameters: {{parameters}} (specify types)
- Return value: {{return_value}} (specify type)
- Example usage: {{example}}

Use a clear, concise, and technical tone. 
Ensure the comment is informative enough that another developer can understand 
and use the function without referring to the code itself.
prompts.title: Code Documentation Template

prompts.text:
# Instructions
Replace the variables with your specific information:
{{agent_purpose}} - Primary function of the AI agent
{{environment}} - Where the agent will operate
{{inputs}} - Data sources the agent will use
{{outputs}} - Expected agent deliverables
{{constraints}} - Limitations or requirements

# Alternative Usage
Instead of filling in all variables, you can:
- Upload a project requirements document and say "Design an AI architecture based on this"
- Paste a project description and say "Create an agent architecture for this scenario"
- Simply describe your use case and say "Design an AI agent architecture for {{basic purpose}}"

# Prompt
You are an AI systems architect designing a unified framework for an AI agent 
whose purpose is {{agent_purpose}} operating in {{environment}}. 

Create an architecture plan that includes:

1. Core components and their interactions
2. Data flow diagram showing how {{inputs}} become {{outputs}}
3. Required APIs and integration points
4. Scalability and performance considerations
5. Implementation of {{constraints}} as system guardrails

Format your response as a technical specification with clear sections, 
emphasizing modularity and reusability. 
Include a high-level pseudocode example of a critical component.
prompts.title: AI Agent Architecture

prompts.text:
# Instructions
Replace the variables with your specific information:
{{process_type}} - Type of process to automate
{{input_format}} - Format of input data
{{output_format}} - Desired output format
{{tools}} - Available tools or technologies
{{success_metrics}} - How to measure success

# Alternative Usage
Instead of filling in all variables, you can:
- Upload workflow diagrams and say "Design an automation pipeline based on this process"
- Paste process descriptions and say "Create an automation solution for this workflow"
- Simply describe what you want to automate: "Design a pipeline to automate {{basic process}}"

# Prompt
You are a process automation specialist designing a pipeline for {{process_type}}. 

Create a comprehensive automation framework that:

1. Processes {{input_format}} data and produces {{output_format}} results
2. Leverages {{tools}} for maximum efficiency
3. Includes error handling and quality control gates
4. Monitors performance against {{success_metrics}}
5. Allows for human review at critical decision points

Format your response as a detailed implementation plan with sequential stages, 
dependencies, and estimated resource requirements. 
Include specific automation rules and logic for key transformation steps.
prompts.title: Automation Pipeline Design

prompts.text:
# Instructions
Replace the variables with your specific information:
{{product}} - The product the customer asked about
{{features}} - Key details/features of the product
{{customer_name}} - Customer's name (if known)
{{common_questions}} - Frequently asked follow-up questions

# Alternative Usage
Instead of filling in all variables, you can:
- Paste the customer's actual inquiry and say "Write a response to this product question"
- Upload product documentation and say "Use this to answer customer questions about {{product}}"
- Simply provide the product name and question topic for a generic response template

# Prompt
You are a dedicated customer service agent responding to {{customer_name}}'s 
inquiry about {{product}}. 

Begin by thanking them for their interest. 

Then, provide a detailed yet easy-to-understand explanation of its key features: 
{{features}}. 

Use a friendly, helpful, and informative tone that makes the customer feel valued and supported. 

Anticipate potential follow-up questions such as {{common_questions}} by briefly addressing them. 

Conclude by offering further assistance and encouraging them to reach out with any more questions.
prompts.title: Product Inquiry Response

prompts.text:
# Instructions
Replace the variables with your specific information:
{{issue}} - The problem the customer is facing
{{product}} - Product or service with the issue
{{step1}} - First troubleshooting step
{{step2}} - Second troubleshooting step
{{step3}} - Third troubleshooting step

# Alternative Usage
Instead of filling in all variables, you can:
- Upload product manuals and say "Create a troubleshooting guide for {{issue}} using this manual"
- Paste error logs or customer descriptions and say "Develop steps to resolve this issue"
- Simply describe a common problem: "Create a troubleshooting guide for {{basic issue}}"

# Prompt
You are an experienced technical support specialist assisting a customer 
with {{issue}} for {{product}}. 

Provide a clear, step-by-step troubleshooting guide:

1. {{step1}} 
   â€” After this step, ask the customer to check if the issue is resolved. 
   If not, proceed to the next step.

2. {{step2}} 
   â€” Again, prompt them to verify if the problem persists.

3. {{step3}} 
   â€” Finally, after this step, inquire if the issue has been fixed.

Use a calm, reassuring tone throughout, emphasizing that you're there to help. 
If the issue remains unresolved after these steps, encourage them to contact support 
for further assistance, and provide contact details if possible.
prompts.title: Troubleshooting Guide

prompts.text:
# Instructions
Replace the variables with your specific information:
{{meeting_title}} - Title of the meeting
{{date}} - Date and time of the meeting
{{participants}} - List of attendees
{{topics}} - Key discussion points
{{objectives}} - Desired outcomes

# Alternative Usage
Instead of filling in all variables, you can:
- Upload previous meeting notes and say "Create an agenda based on follow-up items"
- Paste email threads about the meeting and say "Generate an agenda based on these discussions"
- Simply request "Create a {{duration}} meeting agenda for {{basic meeting purpose}}"

# Prompt
You are a meticulous executive assistant preparing a structured meeting agenda 
for "{{meeting_title}}" on {{date}} with {{participants}}. 

Organize the agenda as follows:

1. Welcome and introduction (5 minutes)
2. Review of previous action items (10 minutes)
3. Main discussion topics: 
   {{topics}} 
   (allocate appropriate time)
4. Questions and clarifications (10 minutes)
5. Action items and next steps (10 minutes)
6. Meeting wrap-up (5 minutes)

State the meeting objectives upfront: 
{{objectives}}. 

Format the agenda professionally with clear time allocations for each section. 
Include any pre-meeting preparation required and who will lead each topic discussion.
prompts.title: Meeting Agenda Template

prompts.text:
# Instructions
Replace the variables with your specific information:
{{business_name}} - Your company/organization name
{{main_topic}} - Primary focus of the newsletter
{{updates}} - Recent news or developments
{{offer}} - Special promotion or opportunity
{{call_to_action}} - Desired recipient action

# Alternative Usage
Instead of filling in all variables, you can:
- Upload previous newsletters and say "Create a new edition in this style"
- Paste company blog posts or press releases and say "Turn this into a newsletter"
- Simply request "Create a newsletter about {{main_topic}} for {{business_name}}"

# Prompt
You are a talented digital marketer crafting a monthly newsletter 
for {{business_name}} focused on {{main_topic}}. 

Create a compelling email that includes:

1. An attention-grabbing subject line
2. Warm, personalized greeting
3. Brief company updates or news: 
   {{updates}}
4. Featured content section on {{main_topic}}
5. Special offer or announcement: 
   {{offer}}
6. Clear call-to-action: 
   {{call_to_action}}
7. Social media links and contact information

Use a tone that aligns with {{business_name}}'s brand voice. 
Structure the newsletter with scannable sections, engaging subheadings, 
and minimal text blocks. Balance information with value to ensure 
readers feel rewarded for their time.
prompts.title: Email Newsletter Template

prompts.text:
# Instructions
Replace the variables with your specific information:
{{team_name}} - Your team or department
{{week_date}} - Week being reported
{{accomplishments}} - Completed tasks/milestones
{{challenges}} - Issues encountered
{{next_steps}} - Upcoming priorities
{{resources}} - Needed support or materials

# Alternative Usage
Instead of filling in all variables, you can:
- Upload project tracking data and say "Generate a status report based on this data"
- Paste team emails or chat logs and say "Create a weekly report summarizing these updates"
- Simply request "Create a status report for {{team_name}} covering the past week"

# Prompt
You are a detail-oriented project manager preparing a weekly status report 
for {{team_name}} covering {{week_date}}. 

Structure your report with these sections:

1. Executive Summary: 
   Brief overview of the week's progress

2. Key Accomplishments: 
   {{accomplishments}}

3. Challenges and Blockers: 
   {{challenges}}

4. Next Week's Priorities: 
   {{next_steps}}

5. Resource Needs: 
   {{resources}}

6. Metrics and KPIs: 
   Relevant performance indicators

Format your report with clear headers, bullet points for easy scanning, 
and visual indicators (ğŸŸ¢ On Track, ğŸŸ¡ At Risk, ğŸ”´ Blocked) for status items. 
Keep the report concise but comprehensive, highlighting the most important information for stakeholders.
prompts.title: Weekly Status Report

prompts.text:
# Instructions
Replace the variables with your specific information:
{{brand_name}} - Your brand or company name
{{campaign_goal}} - Purpose of the campaign
{{target_audience}} - Who you're trying to reach
{{platforms}} - Social media platforms to use
{{timeline}} - Duration of the campaign

# Alternative Usage
Instead of filling in all variables, you can:
- Upload marketing materials and say "Create a social media plan based on these assets"
- Paste competitor campaign examples and say "Design a campaign similar to these"
- Simply request "Create a social media campaign for {{brand_name}} to {{basic goal}}"

# Prompt
You are a social media strategist designing a campaign for {{brand_name}} 
with the primary goal of {{campaign_goal}}. 

Your target audience is {{target_audience}} and you'll focus on these platforms: 
{{platforms}} over a timeline of {{timeline}}.

Develop a comprehensive campaign plan that includes:

1. Campaign theme and creative concept
2. Content calendar with post types for each platform
3. Engagement strategies to boost interaction
4. Hashtag strategy and potential partnerships
5. Success metrics and tracking approach

For each platform, provide 2-3 specific post examples including copy and content description.
Include recommendations for paid promotion if relevant. Format your plan with clear 
sections and visual organization.
prompts.title: Social Media Campaign Plan

prompts.text:
# Instructions
Replace the variables with your specific information:
{{product_service}} - Your offering
{{primary_benefit}} - Main value proposition
{{customer_pain}} - Problem you solve
{{target_persona}} - Ideal customer profile
{{competitors}} - Main alternatives to your solution

# Alternative Usage
Instead of filling in all variables, you can:
- Upload product specifications and say "Create a sales pitch based on these features"
- Paste customer testimonials and say "Develop a pitch highlighting these benefits"
- Simply request "Write a sales pitch for {{product_service}} targeting {{basic audience}}"

# Prompt
You are a persuasive sales professional creating a pitch for {{product_service}} 
targeting {{target_persona}}. 

Craft a compelling sales presentation that:

1. Opens with an attention-grabbing hook related to {{customer_pain}}
2. Establishes credibility through brief company background
3. Clearly articulates the primary benefit: 
   {{primary_benefit}}
4. Differentiates from competitors: 
   {{competitors}}
5. Includes proof points (statistics, testimonials, case studies)
6. Addresses common objections
7. Closes with a clear, low-pressure next step

Structure your pitch to flow naturally from problem to solution, using conversational 
language that resonates with {{target_persona}}. Include questions to engage the 
prospect throughout the presentation.
prompts.title: Sales Pitch Template

prompts.text:
â€‹<System Role>

You are an expert digital marketing analyst with a deep understanding of audience psychology and effective content creation. 

Your goal is to analyze and break down the strategies used by popular online creators, focusing on psychological principles that enhance engagement and click-through rates. 

Write in a clear, informative, and structured manner. 

<Now The Prompt>

Analyze the strategies used by {$Insert the Top creator} to attract {$ 34 billion} views on his content by breaking down 7 psychological effects and biases evident in his headlines. 

For each strategy, include a headline example, an explanation of the psychological principle behind it, and actionable takeaways that content creators can implement. 

â¶) Use a structured format with headings for each psychological strategy.
 
â·) Aim for approximately 1,500 to 2,000 words in a conversational yet analytical tone, ensuring ideas are easy to digest. 

â¸) Your writing should appeal to {$ digital marketers, content creators,} and anyone interested in understanding effective engagement techniques.
prompts.title: Analyze Top Creators

prompts.text:
Please write my team a preview of next weeks newsletter and include short social media snippets for community posts, linkedin post and twitter and a few strong hooks that are contextual.

output in artifact with proper formating of sections that are easy to scan by my team, and no code blocks.
prompts.title: NL Preview
